title: Everyday im trolling *insert every day im shufflinf music*
body:
Well technically not me. It just seems to fit the theme song of the hellhole im trying to escape im gettin feeders after feeders after feeders after feeders.

Now what im finding glorious is that RITO are like "Nahh we don't encourage that" but then be like "youre trolling? cool, keep ruining the game, like we give a crap lelelelel ruin it and piss off as many people as you can".

I mean, seriously, between the troll building and the intentional feeding for lulz, it's turning low elo to freakin challanger, I can't carry this crap as a support main. I aint no bard with TP fam. 

So why is it so okay to do?
And not be punished for?
Read that a board mod (who conveniently doesn't actually play, and will be amazed if any actually do since its clear they dont know the community at all) who believe it is punishable (stop lying to them riot, its not nice :( )

replies.body:
Which games had someone troll building and intentionally feeding?

I took a look at your last 20 games and these were the only questionable cases I could find:

+ _You had a Jungle Bard who went 1/13/13 with 103 CS_

 His replay on replay.gg showed he was playing seriously in-game though. He successfully ganked a few times, warded for his team, and didn't die intentionally at all.

 Of course, I don't know the pre-game context to this. If he let people know what his strategy was, then this is fine. But if he didn't even try communicate with the team it's kinda douchey and probably punishable.


+ _You had a 1/12/0 Fiora Top with 68 CS_

 I thought this was the game you were angry about until I realized this player was your duo partner. So I'm assuming this was just a really bad game and not int. feeding, since you went on to play a few more games with him after that.

__*

Also could you expand on why you think we're disconnected with the community?

I do what I can to understand all perspectives and see why people think that way. But I imagine I often slip up in many cases and completely misunderstand what's going on.
